definitions.definition: in a way that is accurate or true, without any mistakes

examples.text: Students **correctly identified** 16 trees species found on their study sites.
If I **remember correctly**, he was still the prime minister at that point.
They reasoned, correctly, that she was away for the weekend.

definitions.definition: in a way that is right and suitable, so that something is done as it should be done

examples.text: When correctly applied, fake tan is difficult to tell from the real thing.

definitions.definition: in a way that follows the accepted standards or rules
